result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Calvin Anthony Ridley

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Calvin Anthony Ridley in court.  Attorney Lori Ann Kuehn in court for Calvin Anthony Ridley.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for status of counsel. Attorney Kuehn has been appointed.  Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for Preliminary Hearing in Branch PE.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Calvin Anthony Ridley in court in person.  Prosecuting attorney Abby Rockendorf appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case is set for a Preliminary Hearing. State's Witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Case is adjourned. Court orders case adjourned for CAUSE for a Status of Counsel.
Status conference scheduled for October 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed. Appointment Status Letter

Defendant Calvin Anthony Ridley in court, appear in person.  Student Intern Caroline Pellegrini with Gregg Herman appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. SPD has not appointed counsel. State request a State V-Lee hearing, court denied request. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 2, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Report 8.5.22
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.

Defendant Calvin Anthony Ridley in court with attorney William Hotchkiss.  Defendant Calvin Anthony Ridley in custody.  Michael J. Odden appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Calvin Anthony Ridley appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rosa, Branch 35.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.   DEFENDANT IS NOT INDIGENT.  Parties are advised that effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Audrey Skwierawski, Branch 41 in Room 501 of the Courthouse.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has NOT been obtained from the Defendant.  Court ordered the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to obtain DNA sample from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Case is adjourned to Br. PE for Br. 41.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered no contact with K A N
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.

Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
K WARRANT
